definition: to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
see 誇海口|夸海口[kua1 hai3 kou3]
There is no need to boast about one's treasures. (idiom)
pinyin: you3 bao3 he2 bi4 ren2 qian2 kua1

sentences.english: Nothing pleased my mother more than to be told how good were her dishes.
sentences.chinese: 誇母親的菜做得多好，沒什麼比這更使她高興的了。

sentences.english: He boasted that he was the best swimmer in the city.
sentences.chinese: 他誇口說他是本市最優秀的游泳者。

sentences.english: I knew you would praise me.
The friend often sojourns , our home has boast quite of grade.
sentences.chinese: 朋友每每來作客，都誇我們家挺有品位的。

sentences.english: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that show my weakness.
sentences.chinese: 我若必須自誇，就誇那關乎我軟弱的事便了。

sentences.english: Maybe she dresses well, is efficient or extremely punctual.
sentences.chinese: 比如，誇女孩衣着得體，辦事有效率或者是極其守時。

sentences.english: She smiles when you praise her.
sentences.chinese: 每當你誇她的時候她就笑。

sentences.english: Pluto has a moon, called Charon, which is about the size of Quaoar itself.
sentences.chinese: 冥王星有一顆衛星，叫卡戎，和誇歐爾差不多大。

sentences.english: He bragged that he was the highest scorer.
sentences.chinese: 他誇他是最高的得分手。

sentences.english: No need to praise good color the fragrance spreads.
sentences.chinese: 不要人誇顏色好，只留香氣滿乾坤。

sentences.english: He boasts that he is an authority.
Comenius' ideas on art of teaching are very rich.
sentences.chinese: 誇美紐斯的教學藝術思想十分豐富。

sentences.english: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing?
sentences.chinese: 我們的盼望和喜樂，並所誇的冠冕，是什麼呢。

sentences.english: P. g. 67 shows his pomposity and his status earned by association with her.
sentences.chinese: 說明他的大讚誇詞和通過她所贏得的地位。

sentences.english: Quaoar appears to be very similar in size and material.
sentences.chinese: 誇歐爾的大小和構成物質與它非常相似。

sentences.english: Though I never see him, my mother often praised he was a hardworking person.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我沒見過這個叔叔，但偶爾能聽到我媽誇他勤快。

to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
